exceptions.exn: In environment n : nat f := fun (k i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) => match ρ with | INCₐ x => INCₐ (pos_nxt x) | DECₐ x j => DECₐ (pos_nxt x) (if Nat.eq_dec i j then 1 + k else if le_lt_dec k j then 0 else j) end : nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n)) g := fix g (k i : nat) P {struct P} : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) := match P with | nil => nil | ρ :: P0 => f k i ρ :: g k (S i) P0 end : nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n)) -> list (mm_instr (pos (S n))) g_app : forall (k i : nat) P Q, g k i (P ++ Q) = g k i P ++ g k (length P + i) Q g_app_inv : forall (k i : nat) P (l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))), g k i P = l ++ r -> exists L R : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = L ++ R /\\ l = g k i L /\\ r = g k (length l + i) R length_g : forall (l i : nat) P, length (g l i P) = length P k, i : nat P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) j : nat ρ : mm_instr (pos n) H : (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, P) x : list (mm_instr (pos n)) H0 : exists r : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = x ++ (ρ :: nil) ++ r /\\ j = i + length x Unable to unify "forall (i : nat) (x : pos ?M1451), ~ (i, DECₐ x i :: nil) <sc (?M1452, ?M1453 ++ ?M1454)" with "exists l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n))), g k i P = l ++ f k j ρ :: r /\\ j = i + length l".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
f: nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n))
g: nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n)) -> list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))
g_app: forall (k i : nat) P Q, g k i (P ++ Q) = g k i P ++ g k (length P + i) Q
g_app_inv: forall (k i : nat) P (l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))), g k i P = l ++ r -> exists L R : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = L ++ R /\ l = g k i L /\ r = g k (length l + i) R
length_g: forall (l i : nat) P, length (g l i P) = length P
i: nat
k: nat
P: list (mm_instr (pos n))
j: nat
ρ: mm_instr (pos n)

Goal:
(j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, P) -> (j, f k j ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P)

Premises:

mm_no_self_loops_app : forall (n i : nat) (P Q : list (mm_instr (pos n))), mm_no_self_loops (i, P) -> mm_no_self_loops (length P + i, Q) -> mm_no_self_loops (i, P ++ Q)
